text:
Hello everyone,
regarding this recent update
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/ssl-certificate-migration-notice>
can someone please suggest which checks (if any) have to be done in order to be sure not to have any disservice?
<@U01QVR44MEY> do you happen to know more about this topic?
Thank you.
Unless you're running an old Java server somewhere that is checking for old SSL certs, you don't need to do anything

I don't think so. In the "Migration tips and resources" section of that page I see that Java is mentioned but actually my company uses Node.js and Python only, as far as I know, so it seems that having recent versions of those should be enough to be on the safe side, right?

I'm reading this too but I don't think there is anything to do...
yeah I was just using Java as an example, 99.9% of modern code and services won't be affected by this unless you're writing your own DNS or SSL cert engine
basically if you have to ask "will I be affected by this?", and you don't have a ton of legacy code running, you're not going to be affected
of course man, let me know if you need anything
